abstract: Federal District Court Judge Richard M Berman rules in favor of New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady and coach Bill Belichick, overturning NFL's four-game suspension; cites precedent of 1991 case in which Belichick, as Cleveland Browns coach, fined receiver Reggie Langhorne and lost appeal because Langhorne had not been told exactly how certain transgressions would be punished; notes Brady was never told details in advance of his suspension for deflated football scandal.
lead_paragraph: Bill Belichick was a rookie head coach when he disciplined receiver Reggie Langhorne for not hustling. When the penalty was reduced, it established a precedent invoked Thursday.

headline.main: 1991 Suspension of Reggie Langhorne Plays Into Tom Brady Decision
headline.print_headline: Belichick’s Loss in 1990s Set Up Win in 2015
